PerfectNetExp.abs: teetotaller 禁酒者teetotum 四方陀螺teevee 电视
创业阶段困难 teething troubles手转陀螺 teetotum索道，缆道 teleferic

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 18th cent. (as T totum): from T (representing totum, inscribed on the side of the toy) + Latin totum 'the whole' (stake). The letters on the sides (representing Latin words) were T (= totum), A (= auferre 'take away'), D (= deponere 'put down'), and N (= nihil 'nothing')

means.word_mean: 1. a conical child's plaything tapering to a steel point on which it can be made to spin;

sentences.sentence: "he got a bright red top and string for his birthday"
